subject: AI & Agents
title: AI Watermarking: Proving What's Real
description: A short lesson to help you apply AI Watermarking: Proving What's Real.

hook.text: An invisible digital signature embedded in AI-generated text proves a machine wrote it. Undetectable to humans.

buildup.text: Watermarking embeds subtle statistical patterns in AI outputs that detection tools can identify.

discovery.text: Google's SynthID watermarks AI images and text without affecting quality or user experience.

twist.text: Paraphrasing, cropping, or translating can remove watermarks. No system is fully robust yet.

climax.text: Watermarking may become mandatory for AI-generated content under emerging regulations worldwide.

punchline.text: Tag the fake so the real stays trustworthy.

quiz.question: What challenge do AI watermarking systems face?
options: Simple modifications like paraphrasing can remove the watermark
Watermarks make AI content visibly different
No one is working on AI watermarking
